page.title: 04A LOCAL CHARACTER:
page.content: Mr Herbie Rodgers is 78 years old, he has lived in Mylor all his life. He attended school at Tremayne Hall, which was a mixed C of E. He left here at 12 and went on to the boys Grammar school in Falmouth, he left here at 15. He and his friends all got jobs easily. For 20 years Mr Rodgers was a builder in Penryn, his friends got jobs in the docks or as farmers, some went up to Coventry to work as builders but not many moved away. During the war he was based at Pendennis and St. Mawes castles. He was there for 4 years but on V.E. day he was in the Channel Islands liberating them. He was a member of the dramatic society which was started in 1930, and he taught at the Sunday school for 60 years.
